directories.name: Google Business Profile
directories.notes: Non-negotiable. Parents search 'baby classes Farnham' and 'sensory classes near me' on Google. Maps result is often the first thing they see. Needs photos, correct hours, booking link, and reviews. Competitors Baby Sensory and Lullababy appear in Maps already.

directories.name: Happity
directories.notes: THE discovery platform for baby classes in the UK. 2.6M parents/year. Competitors are already listed: Lullababy (happity.co.uk/lullababy/aldershot-farnham-farnborough), Baby Sensory Basingstoke/Alton/Farnham. Classes at Wrecclesham Community Centre, Tongham, Farnham URC Church, Spire Church all listed. TW's ABSENCE here is a critical gap. Multiple Farnham venues already indexed.

directories.name: Farnham Rocks
directories.notes: Local Farnham family directory listing baby/toddler classes and groups. Well-indexed by Google for Farnham-specific searches. Covers Farnham, Farnborough, Camberley, Alton, Bordon, Fleet. Submit a listing — this is where local parents browse.

directories.name: Surrey Family Information Directory
directories.notes: Official Surrey County Council directory. Health visitors and children's centre staff refer parents here. Lists toddler groups in Farnham already. Getting listed adds official credibility and may be referenced by health professionals.

directories.name: Surrey Mummy
directories.notes: Award-winning Surrey parent directory. Silver award at Surrey Digital Awards for social media. Parents search and review activities here. Submit a listing and encourage parent reviews.

directories.name: Netmums Local
directories.notes: Still used by parents searching for local activities. Less dominant than Happity but good for SEO backlink and additional discovery surface.

directories.name: Toddle About
directories.notes: Lists mums & tots groups by area. Less traffic than Happity but another free listing that takes 10 mins.

directories.name: Pembee Profile
directories.notes: Already using Pembee for booking. Ensure the Pembee profile is fully completed with photos, descriptions, and class details. Some parents discover classes through Pembee search.

communities.name: Love Farnham (Facebook Page)
communities.self_promo_rules: Community page — may share local business news. Check if they accept listings.
communities.strategy: Follow and engage. Ask if they'd share a 'new local business' feature. Good for launch announcement.

communities.name: Surrey Mums Meet (Facebook Group)
communities.self_promo_rules: Check group rules — many allow promo on specific days.
communities.strategy: Join, be helpful for 2 weeks, then share when relevant. When someone asks for Farnham baby class recommendations, mention TW naturally.

communities.name: Farnham Community / Farnham Families (Facebook Groups)
communities.url: Search Facebook for 'Farnham mums', 'Farnham families', 'Farnham community'
communities.self_promo_rules: Most local groups have promo rules. Some allow 'promo Friday' or 'small business Saturday'.
communities.strategy: Find and join ALL Farnham-area parent/community groups. Search terms: 'Farnham mums', 'Farnham parents', 'Farnham baby', 'Aldershot mums', 'Farnham community', 'Waverley mums'. Aim to join 5-8 groups. Help first, promote later per EXP-004.

communities.name: NCT Farnham / Waverley (Facebook Group)
communities.url: Search Facebook for 'NCT Farnham' or 'NCT Waverley'
communities.members: Varies — NCT groups are typically 200-1,000 but HIGHLY concentrated ICP
communities.self_promo_rules: NCT groups are often moderated. May need to contact NCT branch coordinator to share. DO NOT spam.
communities.strategy: This is the highest-value community. Contact the local NCT branch directly (nct.org.uk) and offer a free taster session (EXP-007). NCT coordinators actively seek activities for their groups. A personal introduction beats a group post.

communities.name: Nextdoor (Farnham area)
communities.self_promo_rules: Business pages available. Neighbours can recommend local businesses. Organic recommendations carry weight.
communities.strategy: Create a free Nextdoor Business page. Post a friendly introduction: 'New baby sensory studio opening in Farnham!' Nextdoor is trusted for local recommendations. Less useful than Facebook groups for baby-specific discovery but good for general local visibility.

communities.name: Mumsnet Local (Farnham/Surrey)
communities.members: Low local traffic — Mumsnet Local boards are often quiet
communities.self_promo_rules: Mumsnet Local allows business introductions in the local boards. Main Mumsnet forums do not allow advertising.
communities.strategy: Low priority. Post a friendly introduction in the Mumsnet Local Farnham/Surrey board. Don't expect much traffic — Mumsnet Local is less active than Facebook groups. Worth 10 mins but don't invest more.

communities.name: Instagram Local Accounts
communities.self_promo_rules: No rules — engage genuinely with local accounts
communities.strategy: Follow and engage with: local Farnham businesses, other baby class providers (non-competitive ones like swimming, music), Farnham lifestyle accounts, local photographers who do baby shoots (referral opportunity — Sarah Angel Photography in Farnham does newborn photography and lists local baby classes on her blog). Comment genuinely, build relationships. Tag location as Farnham in every post.

channels: Happity (fully listed with class schedules at Wrecclesham Community Centre)
competitor_presence.notes: STRONGEST local competitor presence. Active on Happity with multiple class times. Operating from community centres in Farnham area. TW needs to match their directory presence at minimum.

channels: National brand SEO (ranks for 'baby sensory' generically)
competitor_presence.notes: Benefits from national brand SEO. When parents search 'baby sensory' they find the franchise first. TW needs to compete on 'Farnham' + 'sensory' local terms.
Active in Farnham area. Standard franchise presence.

channels: Own website with active blog (published comparison article of local sensory classes Oct 2025)
competitor_presence.notes: Interesting — Vivace published a blog comparing local sensory classes. This means they're doing content marketing. TW should reach out to Karen Hurley (mentioned as compiling Local Family Events directory) for inclusion.

locations.name: Farnham Centre for Health (health visitors)
locations.action: Visit in person. Introduce yourself. Leave 30 leaflets. Ask about noticeboard.
locations.notes: Health visitors are the #1 trusted referral source for new parents. A single HV recommending TW could fill a class.

locations.name: Frimley Park Hospital (maternity ward / postnatal ward noticeboard)
locations.action: Visit the maternity ward reception. Ask about leaving leaflets on the community noticeboard. Some hospitals have a 'local activities' rack.
locations.notes: Nearest major maternity unit. Every parent leaving with a newborn passes the noticeboard. May need to go through PALS or reception.

locations.name: Local midwife practices / GP surgeries with baby clinics
locations.action: Identify 3-4 GP surgeries in Farnham that run baby weigh-in clinics. Visit and leave leaflets.
locations.notes: Baby weigh-in clinics are weekly gatherings of exactly the ICP. Noticeboards here get read while parents wait.

locations.name: Farnham Library (Vernon House, 28 West Street, GU9 7DR)
locations.action: Visit the library. Ask about the community noticeboard. Farnham Library runs rhyme time sessions — parents attending those are the exact ICP. Leave leaflets.
locations.notes: Library rhyme time parents are proven activity-seekers. Community noticeboard is free. Library staff may also verbally recommend.

locations.name: Farnham Maltings
locations.action: Visit the Maltings cafe and community board. Ask about leaving leaflets or a small poster. The Maltings is a community hub — parents visit for events and the cafe.
locations.notes: Cultural hub of Farnham. Riverside Cafe is popular with families. Community noticeboard visible to high footfall.

locations.name: Farnham URC Church (South Street, GU9 7QU)
locations.action: Already hosts toddler groups (Wednesdays and Fridays 10am-11:30am per Surrey directory). Visit the toddler group, introduce yourself, leave leaflets. Parents attending free church groups are potential upsell to paid sensory classes.
locations.notes: Free toddler group attendees are the ICP. Not competitors — complementary. Parents often attend both free and paid activities.

locations.name: The Spire Church, Farnham
locations.action: Hosts baby/toddler activities per Happity. Leave leaflets on community board.
locations.notes: Another venue hosting baby activities. Community noticeboard.

locations.name: Wrecclesham Community Centre
locations.action: Lullababy already operates here. Leave leaflets on the community noticeboard but be aware competitor classes run from here.
locations.notes: Competitor territory. Still worth a noticeboard presence but don't invest time.

locations.name: Cafe Coco, Farnham
locations.action: Visit, ask if you can leave a small stack of leaflets or postcards by the till / on the community board.
locations.notes: Mentioned as community-serving cafe. Baby-friendly cafes are where new parents go after classes and meetups.

locations.name: Other Farnham cafes with noticeboards
locations.action: Walk the high street. Any cafe with a community noticeboard or leaflet rack — ask to leave cards. Target cafes near car parks or buggy-accessible locations.
locations.notes: Scatter 5-10 leaflets across 4-5 cafes. Takes 30 mins on a walk through town. Minimal effort, passive discovery.

locations.name: Farnham nurseries (identify 3-5 local nurseries)
locations.action: Visit with leaflets. Nurseries serve an older age range (2-5) but parents of babies often have older children at nursery. Ask if they have a 'local activities' board for parents.
locations.notes: Secondary channel. Parents picking up children at nursery are time-poor but may have a younger baby at home.

locations.name: Local Family Events (compiled by Karen Hurley)
locations.action: Contact Karen Hurley (mentioned in Vivace Music School blog as compiling the most comprehensive local baby class listing for Fleet/Farnham/Yateley). Ask to be included.
locations.notes: A trusted local curator. Being included in her listings = credibility and discovery. Vivace referenced her directly.

locations.name: Sarah Angel Photography blog
locations.action: Sarah Angel Photography (Farnham) published a blog post listing 'Top Newborn Baby Groups and Classes in Farnham'. Contact her to be added to the list. Also explore a cross-referral: she photographs babies, you run baby classes — natural partnership.
locations.notes: Her blog ranks on Google for Farnham baby class searches. Being listed = SEO backlink + referral traffic. Mutual referral opportunity.

actions.notes: Full profile with 10+ photos, booking link, class descriptions. Verify the business.
Complete listing with all class types, ages, pricing, photos, booking link. This is where competitors already are.
Local directory specifically for Farnham families. Quick win.

actions.action: Visit Farnham health centre + Farnham Library with leaflets
actions.notes: In person. Introduce yourself. Leave leaflets. Ask about noticeboards. This is the highest-impact action in the entire plan.

actions.action: Visit Frimley Park Hospital maternity reception with leaflets
actions.notes: Ask about community noticeboard in maternity/postnatal ward.

actions.time: 30 mins to join, then 15-20 mins/day engagement
actions.notes: Search: 'Farnham mums', 'Surrey mums', 'Farnham community', 'Farnham parents', 'NCT Farnham/Waverley', 'Aldershot and Farnham'. Be helpful for 2 weeks before any promotion.

actions.action: Submit to Surrey Family Information Directory
actions.notes: Official council directory. Health visitors reference this.

actions.action: Submit to Surrey Mummy, Netmums Local, Toddle About
actions.notes: Batch these. 10 mins each. Free listings, passive discovery.
Post a friendly introduction. Nextdoor neighbours trust local recommendations.
Offer a free taster session at their next coffee morning. This is the highest-conversion channel after health visitors.

actions.action: Contact Karen Hurley (Local Family Events) + Sarah Angel Photography
actions.notes: Ask to be included in their Farnham baby class listings. Mutual referral opportunity with Sarah Angel.

actions.action: Leaflet drop: Farnham Maltings, Farnham URC Church toddler group, 3-4 baby-friendly cafes
actions.notes: Visit the URC Church toddler group in person (Wed or Fri 10am). Meet parents directly. Leave leaflets at the Maltings and cafes.

actions.action: Explore partnership with a local baby-friendly cafe (cross-promotion)
actions.notes: Offer: 'Our parents get 10% off coffee after class / you display our leaflets.' Mutual benefit.
Secondary channel. Parents of nursery-age children may have younger babies.

actions.action: If classes are filling: collect 5-10 Google reviews to dominate local search
actions.notes: Reviews are the strongest Google Maps ranking signal. Ask after every class.

actions.action: Explore a listing on ClassForKids if available in the area
actions.notes: Another booking/discovery platform. Lower priority than Happity.

actions.action: Consider one £50 Facebook/Instagram ad targeting Farnham parents with babies 0-12 months
actions.notes: ONLY if organic channels are working and you want to accelerate. Not before month 2. Need 300+ followers and 20+ posts as social proof first.
Quick post on the Surrey/Farnham local board. Low traffic but takes 5 mins.

skip.why: Wrong platform for the ICP. Farnham mums aged 28-38 discovering local baby classes are on Instagram and Facebook, not TikTok. The effort-to-return ratio is terrible for a local business. Revisit in 12+ months if Instagram is mature.
Parents don't search for baby classes on X. Zero local discovery value. Not worth any time.
ICP is not searching for baby classes on LinkedIn. Only relevant future-state for franchise recruitment. Not now.
This is a local service business, not a tech product. These platforms have zero relevance.

Budget is £30-50 total. Google Ads for local services cost £1-3 per click. The budget would last 1-2 days. Google Business Profile (free) achieves the same goal. Revisit only if revenue is proven and you want to scale.
Expensive (£200+), wrong audience (newspaper readers skew older), and unmeasurable. Leaflets at health centres reach 10x more of the ICP for 1/10th the cost.
Hoop has closed/been absorbed. Traffic now goes to Happity. Don't waste time looking for it.
Yelp is irrelevant for baby classes in the UK. Google reviews and Happity reviews are what matters.
